Sure, here are 5 use cases in Earth Observation that are required today by the end users in the insurance and finance segment:

1. Risk assessment and management: Earth Observation data can help insurance and finance companies to assess and manage risks associated with natural disasters such as floods, hurricanes, and wildfires. This can help them to better estimate potential losses and set premiums accordingly.
2. Crop monitoring: Earth Observation data can be used to monitor crop health and yield, providing valuable information to insurance companies that offer crop insurance. This information can help them to better estimate potential losses and adjust their policies accordingly.
3. Property and infrastructure monitoring: Earth Observation data can be used to monitor changes in the condition of buildings, bridges, and other infrastructure. This can help insurance and finance companies to better estimate the risk of structural damage and set premiums accordingly.
4. Climate modeling: Earth Observation data can be used to build models that simulate the impact of climate change on various regions and industries. This information can help insurance and finance companies to better estimate potential losses and adjust their policies accordingly.
5. Fraud detection: Earth Observation data can be used to verify insurance claims, especially in cases of natural disasters. By cross-referencing data from different sources, insurance companies can better detect fraudulent claims and reduce losses.
